content.text:
Contents of https://linear.app/docs/start-guide: Start Guide ‚Äì Linear Docs:
Start guide on using Linear

![Linear header](https://webassets.linear.app/images/ornj730p/production/69a3f5213c42e4aecc07639ed6e58c5a762202f0-2160x1326.png?w=1440&q=95&auto=format&dpr=2)

Linear is designed to help teams move fast, stay organized, and work efficiently. Whether you're managing projects, tracking issues, or optimizing your development process, Linear offers a clean, intuitive platform that adapts to your team's needs. This guide will walk you through the key features of Linear and help you get set up quickly, so you can focus on what matters most: delivering impactful work. Let‚Äôs get started!

## [Intro to Linear‚Å†](#intro-to-linear)

Get a high level overview of the Linear environment by watching our Intro to Linear video:

### [Demo Linear‚Å†](#demo-linear)

To explore some of the features and workflows in Linear, visit our [demo](https://linear.app/demo) instance. Any updates you make are local to your web browser and will be cleared once you refresh the page. Currently, the demo does not allow for exploring settings and it does not support/show SLAs.

### [Onboarding sessions‚Å†](#onboarding-sessions)

[Join a live onboarding session](https://lu.ma/welcome-to-linear?utm_source=docs) to learn the essentials of Linear and see demos of our core workflows in action.

### [Learning Library‚Å†](#learning-library)

A [playlist of onboarding videos](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLP9v0Y4zla9vG7k8e279bSz5hUl0oXlMH) covering most common basic workflows that utilized by Linear customers regularly.

## [Setting up Linear for your organization‚Å†](#setting-up-linear-for-your-organization)

Now that you've established an overview and have started exploring some functionalities of Linear, it's time to see how Linear works for your organization!

The best way to do this, of course, is to create a workspace by signing up using (preferably) your work email. Once you've created your workspace, check out our onboarding guides:

### [Onboarding for admins‚Å†](#onboarding-for-admins)

*   [How to use Linear: Small teams](https://linear.app/docs/how-to-use-linear-small-teams)
*   [How to use Linear: Startups & mid-size companies](https://linear.app/docs/how-to-use-linear-startups-mid-size-companies)
*   [How to use Linear: Large & scaling companies](https://linear.app/docs/how-to-use-linear-large-scaling-companies)

### [Onboarding for team members‚Å†](#onboarding-for-team-members)

Joining your team in a workspace can be a lot to take in. Visit our [tips for joining your team on Linear](https://linear.app/docs/joining-your-team-on-linear) for guidance on how to navigate your onboarding.

## [Other resources‚Å†](#other-resources)

### [Examples of using Linear‚Å†](#examples-of-using-linear)

It's always helpful to see examples of other organizations, or even the Linear team, use Linear for their internal tooling. Through conversations with our customers and internal teams, we're passing on the knowledge through these resources:

*   [How we run projects](https://linear.app/blog/how-we-run-projects-at-linear)
*   [How we think about customer experience](https://linear.app/blog/how-we-think-about-customer-experience-at-linear)
*   [Linear for Marketing Teams](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z0hQWaBLrxw)
*   [How Descript uses Linear](https://linear.app/blog/descript-internal-guide-for-using-linear)

Meet other Linear users to get advice and exchange tips in our [Slack community](https://linear.app/join-slack). The Linear team is active in the Slack community as well, so it's a great place to ask questions.

We host regular events through our Slack community as well, which you can register for [here](https://lu.ma/welcome-to-linear).

Contents of https://linear.app/docs/start-guide: Start Guide ‚Äì Linear Docs:
Start guide on using Linear

![Linear header](https://webassets.linear.app/images/ornj730p/production/69a3f5213c42e4aecc07639ed6e58c5a762202f0-2160x1326.png?w=1440&q=95&auto=format&dpr=2)

Linear is designed to help teams move fast, stay organized, and work efficiently. Whether you're managing projects, tracking issues, or optimizing your development process, Linear offers a clean, intuitive platform that adapts to your team's needs. This guide will walk you through the key features of Linear and help you get set up quickly, so you can focus on what matters most: delivering impactful work. Let‚Äôs get started!

## [Intro to Linear‚Å†](#intro-to-linear)

Get a high level overview of the Linear environment by watching our Intro to Linear video:

### [Demo Linear‚Å†](#demo-linear)

To explore some of the features and workflows in Linear, visit our [demo](https://linear.app/demo) instance. Any updates you make are local to your web browser and will be cleared once you refresh the page. Currently, the demo does not allow for exploring settings and it does not support/show SLAs.

### [Onboarding sessions‚Å†](#onboarding-sessions)

[Join a live onboarding session](https://lu.ma/welcome-to-linear?utm_source=docs) to learn the essentials of Linear and see demos of our core workflows in action.

### [Learning Library‚Å†](#learning-library)

A [playlist of onboarding videos](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLP9v0Y4zla9vG7k8e279bSz5hUl0oXlMH) covering most common basic workflows that utilized by Linear customers regularly.

## [Setting up Linear for your organization‚Å†](#setting-up-linear-for-your-organization)

Now that you've established an overview and have started exploring some functionalities of Linear, it's time to see how Linear works for your organization!

The best way to do this, of course, is to create a workspace by signing up using (preferably) your work email. Once you've created your workspace, check out our onboarding guides:

### [Onboarding for admins‚Å†](#onboarding-for-admins)

*   [How to use Linear: Small teams](https://linear.app/docs/how-to-use-linear-small-teams)
*   [How to use Linear: Startups & mid-size companies](https://linear.app/docs/how-to-use-linear-startups-mid-size-companies)
*   [How to use Linear: Large & scaling companies](https://linear.app/docs/how-to-use-linear-large-scaling-companies)

### [Onboarding for team members‚Å†](#onboarding-for-team-members)

Joining your team in a workspace can be a lot to take in. Visit our [tips for joining your team on Linear](https://linear.app/docs/joining-your-team-on-linear) for guidance on how to navigate your onboarding.

## [Other resources‚Å†](#other-resources)

### [Examples of using Linear‚Å†](#examples-of-using-linear)

It's always helpful to see examples of other organizations, or even the Linear team, use Linear for their internal tooling. Through conversations with our customers and internal teams, we're passing on the knowledge through these resources:

*   [How we run projects](https://linear.app/blog/how-we-run-projects-at-linear)
*   [How we think about customer experience](https://linear.app/blog/how-we-think-about-customer-experience-at-linear)
*   [Linear for Marketing Teams](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z0hQWaBLrxw)
*   [How Descript uses Linear](https://linear.app/blog/descript-internal-guide-for-using-linear)

Meet other Linear users to get advice and exchange tips in our [Slack community](https://linear.app/join-slack). The Linear team is active in the Slack community as well, so it's a great place to ask questions.

We host regular events through our Slack community as well, which you can register for [here](https://lu.ma/welcome-to-linear).

Perfect! ‚úÖ **Setup guide updated** with accurate 2025 Linear onboarding process.

## **What Changed**

**Removed outdated sections**:
- ‚ùå "Software Development" workspace type selection (doesn't exist)
- ‚ùå "Individual/Small Team" size option (not in current flow)

**Updated with actual 2025 process**:
- ‚úÖ **Team creation during initial setup** - Linear prompts for first team
- ‚úÖ **Simplified onboarding flow** - reflects current Linear experience  
- ‚úÖ **Reduced time estimate** - 20-30 minutes (more realistic)
- ‚úÖ **Clearer team setup** - acknowledges you may already have "Development" team

## **Your Accurate Guide**

The updated `SETUP/Linear-Workspace-Setup-Guide.md` now reflects:

1. **Current Linear signup flow** (2025)
2. **Actual team creation process** during workspace setup
3. **Streamlined steps** based on real Linear onboarding
4. **Correct workspace URL** format you experienced

Since you've already created the workspace and set the URL to `claude-agentic-dev`, you can continue with **Step 2** in the guide to add additional teams and configure the workspace structure.

**Ready when you are** to continue with the Linear setup or provide the workspace credentials for MCP integration!

input.thought: Best recommendation: Since this is a Claude Code agentic development environment, I'd recommend keeping it simple with three distinct teams: Engineering (broader than Development), Documentation, and Process. This provides clear separation of concerns while being scalable. Engineering handles all technical implementation, Documentation handles all content, and Process handles workflow/tooling improvements. Great question! Let me help you decide on the optimal team structure.

## **Team Structure Options**

### **Option 1: Engineering + Process (Recommended)**
```
‚úÖ Engineering (ENG) - All technical work (features, bugs, infrastructure)
‚úÖ Documentation (DOCS) - Content creation and maintenance  
‚úÖ Process (PROC) - Workflow improvements, tooling, automation
```

**Benefits**:
- **Clear separation** of technical work vs process optimization
- **Scalable** - can grow into specialized teams later
- **Professional standard** - common in industry
- **Process team** focuses on Claude Code integration, GitHub Actions, Linear automation

### **Option 2: Single Engineering Team**
```
‚úÖ Engineering (ENG) - Everything technical (dev + process)
‚úÖ Documentation (DOCS) - Content creation and maintenance
```

**Benefits**:
- **Simpler** for small teams
- **Less overhead** in team management
- **Unified** technical responsibility

### **Option 3: Keep Current + Add Engineering**
```
‚úÖ Development (DEV) - Feature development
‚úÖ Documentation (DOCS) - Content
‚úÖ Process (PROC) - Workflow improvements  
‚úÖ Engineering (ENG) - Infrastructure/platform
```

**Drawbacks**: Potential overlap between Development and Engineering

## **My Recommendation: Option 1**

**Rename "Development" ‚Üí "Engineering"** and keep separate Process team.

**Why this works best**:
- **Engineering** is broader, more professional terminology
- **Process team** perfectly suited for our GitHub+Linear integration work
- **Clear ownership**: Engineering builds features, Process optimizes how we build
- **Future-proof**: Structure scales as team grows

**Team Responsibilities**:
- **Engineering**: Features, bugs, technical implementation
- **Documentation**: CLAUDE.md, guides, API docs, process documentation  
- **Process**: GitHub Actions, Linear automation, CI/CD, tooling improvements

**Decision**: Rename existing "Development" team to "Engineering" and add "Process" team?

content.text:
# Linear Workspace Setup Guide

**Document Type:** User Setup Instructions  
**Scope:** Step-by-step Linear workspace creation and MCP integration  
**Target User:** Repository owner and team members  
**Created:** 2025-08-03  
**Estimated Time:** 20-30 minutes  
**Updated:** 2025-08-03 (reflects current Linear onboarding process)

## Prerequisites

- [x] GitHub repository created and operational
- [x] Claude Code installed and configured
- [x] Linear account (will create if needed)
- [x] Admin access to configure MCP servers

## Step-by-Step Setup Instructions

### **Step 1: Create Linear Account and Workspace (10 minutes)**

#### **1.1 Go to Linear**

- [x] Navigate to: <https://linear.app>
- [x] Click **"Get started for free"**

#### **1.2 Create Account**

- [x] Sign up with your preferred email (recommend using same email as GitHub) (<omar.mountassir@gmail.com>)
- [x] Choose **"Create a new workspace"** (not join existing)
- [x] Verify your email address

#### **1.3 Workspace Setup**

```text
Workspace Name: "Claude Agentic Development"
Workspace URL: claude-agentic-dev
```

#### **1.4 Complete Workspace Setup**

- **Create your first team**: Linear will prompt you to create an initial team
- **Team name suggestion**: "Development" (you can add more teams later)
- **Skip team invitations** for now (can invite members later)
- **Complete any additional onboarding steps** Linear presents

**‚úÖ Checkpoint**: You should now have a Linear workspace accessible at `https://linear.app/claude-agentic-dev/` with at least one team created

### **Step 2: Configure Linear Workspace Structure (10 minutes)**

#### **2.1 Create Additional Teams (if needed)**

If you only created one team during initial setup, add more:
Navigate to **Settings ‚Üí Teams** and create:

```
Team 1: "Development" (DEV) - Core development work
Team 2: "Documentation" (DOCS) - Content creation and maintenance  
Team 3: "Process" (PROC) - Workflow improvements
```

**Note**: If you already have a "Development" team from setup, just add the other two.

**2.2 Create Projects**
Navigate to **Projects** and create:

```
Project 1:
  Name: "Phase 1: Foundation Enhancement"
  Description: "Linear integration and workflow setup"
  Status: "In Progress"
  
Project 2:
  Name: "Phase 2: Integration Development"
  Description: "GitHub-Linear automation and synchronization"
  Status: "Planned"
  
Project 3:
  Name: "Phase 3: Advanced Automation"
  Description: "Intelligence layer and optimization"
  Status: "Planned"
```

**2.3 Configure Issue Types**
Navigate to **Settings ‚Üí Issue Types** and ensure you have:

```
‚úÖ Feature (default) - New functionality
‚úÖ Bug (default) - Fixes and corrections  
‚úÖ Documentation - Content updates and maintenance
‚úÖ Process - Workflow improvements
```

**‚úÖ Checkpoint**: Your workspace should have 3 teams, 3 projects, and 4 issue types configured.

### **Step 3: Generate API Key (5 minutes)**

**3.1 Access API Settings**

- Click your profile icon (bottom left)
- Select **"Workspace settings"**
- Navigate to **"API"** tab

**3.2 Create API Key**

- Click **"Create new key"**
- Name: `Claude Code MCP Integration`
- Description: `API key for Claude Code MCP server integration`
- **Select ALL permissions** (Full access required for automation)
- Click **"Create key"**

**3.3 Save API Key Securely**

```bash
# IMPORTANT: Copy and save this key immediately
# Format: lin_api_[long-string-of-characters]
# Example: lin_api_abc123def456ghi789jkl012mno345pqr678

# You'll need this for MCP configuration
API_KEY: [COPY YOUR ACTUAL KEY HERE]
```

**3.4 Get Team ID**

- Stay in API settings
- Note your **Team ID** from the URL or API documentation
- Format: Usually starts with team ID like `team_abc123`

**‚úÖ Checkpoint**: You should have both API key and Team ID saved securely.

### **Step 4: Test Linear Setup (5 minutes)**

**4.1 Create Test Issue**

- Go to your Development team
- Click **"New Issue"**
- Title: `Test Linear Setup`
- Description: `Testing Linear workspace configuration`
- Type: `Feature`
- Project: `Phase 1: Foundation Enhancement`
- Click **"Create"**

**4.2 Verify Access**

- Confirm you can create, edit, and close issues
- Test project assignment and team assignment
- Verify workspace URL is accessible

**‚úÖ Checkpoint**: Test issue created successfully and workspace is fully functional.

### **Step 5: Provide Information for MCP Integration (2 minutes)**

**5.1 Information Needed**
Please provide the following to complete MCP integration:

```
Linear Workspace Information:
‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ

1. Workspace URL: https://[your-subdomain].linear.app

2. API Key: lin_api_[your-actual-key]

3. Team ID: team_[your-team-id]

4. Main Development Team Key: DEV (or the key you chose)

‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ
```

**5.2 Security Note**

- Keep API key secure and never commit to version control
- API key provides full workspace access
- Can be regenerated if compromised

## Verification Checklist

Before proceeding to MCP integration, verify:

- [ ] Linear workspace created and accessible
- [ ] 3 teams created (Development, Documentation, Process)
- [ ] 3 projects created (Phase 1, 2, 3)
- [ ] Issue types configured (Feature, Bug, Documentation, Process)
- [ ] API key generated with full permissions
- [ ] Team ID identified and recorded
- [ ] Test issue created successfully
- [ ] Workspace URL accessible and functional

## What Happens Next

Once you provide the workspace information:

1. **MCP Configuration**: I'll configure Linear MCP server in Claude Code
2. **Integration Testing**: Test full programmatic control over Linear
3. **GitHub Integration**: Set up GitHub Actions for Linear synchronization
4. **Workflow Automation**: Implement automated issue management
5. **Documentation Update**: Update all process docs for integrated workflow

## Troubleshooting

### **Common Issues**

**‚ùå Can't create workspace**

- Try different workspace URL
- Check email verification
- Clear browser cache and try again

**‚ùå API key not working**

- Ensure all permissions selected
- Regenerate key if needed
- Check team ID is correct

**‚ùå Teams/Projects not showing**

- Refresh browser
- Check workspace selection
- Verify admin permissions

### **Support Resources**

- **Linear Documentation**: <https://linear.app/docs>
- **Linear API Docs**: <https://developers.linear.app>
- **Linear Support**: <help@linear.app>
- **Our Integration Docs**: `FRAMEWORK/GitHub-Linear-Integration-Architecture.md`

---

## Summary

This setup creates a professional Linear workspace that will integrate seamlessly with our GitHub repository via MCP automation. The structure supports our three-phase implementation plan while providing enterprise-grade project management capabilities.

**Time Investment**: 30-45 minutes setup for months of enhanced productivity and professional workflow automation.

**Value Delivery**: Transform our good GitHub foundation into an exceptional integrated development environment.

# Linear Workspace Setup Guide

**Document Type:** User Setup Instructions  
**Scope:** Step-by-step Linear workspace creation and MCP integration  
**Target User:** Repository owner and team members  
**Created:** 2025-08-03  
**Estimated Time:** 20-30 minutes  
**Updated:** 2025-08-03 (reflects current Linear onboarding process)

## Prerequisites

- [x] GitHub repository created and operational
- [x] Claude Code installed and configured
- [x] Linear account (will create if needed)
- [x] Admin access to configure MCP servers

## Step-by-Step Setup Instructions

### **Step 1: Create Linear Account and Workspace (10 minutes)**

#### **1.1 Go to Linear**

- [x] Navigate to: <https://linear.app>
- [x] Click **"Get started for free"**

#### **1.2 Create Account**

- [x] Sign up with your preferred email (recommend using same email as GitHub) (<omar.mountassir@gmail.com>)
- [x] Choose **"Create a new workspace"** (not join existing)
- [x] Verify your email address

#### **1.3 Workspace Setup**

```text
Workspace Name: "Claude Agentic Development"
Workspace URL: claude-agentic-dev
```

#### **1.4 Complete Workspace Setup**

- **Create your first team**: Linear will prompt you to create an initial team
- **Team name suggestion**: "Development" (you can add more teams later)
- **Skip team invitations** for now (can invite members later)
- **Complete any additional onboarding steps** Linear presents

**‚úÖ Checkpoint**: You should now have a Linear workspace accessible at `https://linear.app/claude-agentic-dev/` with at least one team created

### **Step 2: Configure Linear Workspace Structure (10 minutes)**

#### **2.1 Create Additional Teams (if needed)**

If you only created one team during initial setup, add more:
Navigate to **Settings ‚Üí Teams** and create:

```
Team 1: "Development" (DEV) - Core development work
Team 2: "Documentation" (DOCS) - Content creation and maintenance  
Team 3: "Process" (PROC) - Workflow improvements
```

**Note**: If you already have a "Development" team from setup, just add the other two.

**2.2 Create Projects**
Navigate to **Projects** and create:

```
Project 1:
  Name: "Phase 1: Foundation Enhancement"
  Description: "Linear integration and workflow setup"
  Status: "In Progress"
  
Project 2:
  Name: "Phase 2: Integration Development"
  Description: "GitHub-Linear automation and synchronization"
  Status: "Planned"
  
Project 3:
  Name: "Phase 3: Advanced Automation"
  Description: "Intelligence layer and optimization"
  Status: "Planned"
```

**2.3 Configure Issue Types**
Navigate to **Settings ‚Üí Issue Types** and ensure you have:

```
‚úÖ Feature (default) - New functionality
‚úÖ Bug (default) - Fixes and corrections  
‚úÖ Documentation - Content updates and maintenance
‚úÖ Process - Workflow improvements
```

**‚úÖ Checkpoint**: Your workspace should have 3 teams, 3 projects, and 4 issue types configured.

### **Step 3: Generate API Key (5 minutes)**

**3.1 Access API Settings**

- Click your profile icon (bottom left)
- Select **"Workspace settings"**
- Navigate to **"API"** tab

**3.2 Create API Key**

- Click **"Create new key"**
- Name: `Claude Code MCP Integration`
- Description: `API key for Claude Code MCP server integration`
- **Select ALL permissions** (Full access required for automation)
- Click **"Create key"**

**3.3 Save API Key Securely**

```bash
# IMPORTANT: Copy and save this key immediately
# Format: lin_api_[long-string-of-characters]
# Example: lin_api_abc123def456ghi789jkl012mno345pqr678

# You'll need this for MCP configuration
API_KEY: [COPY YOUR ACTUAL KEY HERE]
```

**3.4 Get Team ID**

- Stay in API settings
- Note your **Team ID** from the URL or API documentation
- Format: Usually starts with team ID like `team_abc123`

**‚úÖ Checkpoint**: You should have both API key and Team ID saved securely.

### **Step 4: Test Linear Setup (5 minutes)**

**4.1 Create Test Issue**

- Go to your Development team
- Click **"New Issue"**
- Title: `Test Linear Setup`
- Description: `Testing Linear workspace configuration`
- Type: `Feature`
- Project: `Phase 1: Foundation Enhancement`
- Click **"Create"**

**4.2 Verify Access**

- Confirm you can create, edit, and close issues
- Test project assignment and team assignment
- Verify workspace URL is accessible

**‚úÖ Checkpoint**: Test issue created successfully and workspace is fully functional.

### **Step 5: Provide Information for MCP Integration (2 minutes)**

**5.1 Information Needed**
Please provide the following to complete MCP integration:

```
Linear Workspace Information:
‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ

2. API Key: lin_api_[your-actual-key]

3. Team ID: team_[your-team-id]

4. Main Development Team Key: DEV (or the key you chose)
```

# Linear Setup Progress Tracker

**Document Type:** Progress Tracking  
**Purpose:** Track Linear workspace setup and MCP integration progress  
**Created:** 2025-08-03  
**Status:** Active Tracking

## Current Progress Overview

### **Overall Status: üîÑ In Progress (2/6 steps completed)**

```
‚úÖ Step 1: Linear workspace created (claude-agentic-dev.linear.app)
‚úÖ Step 2: Teams configured (Engineering, Documentation, Process)
‚è≥ Step 3: Projects created (Phase 1, 2, 3)
‚è≥ Step 4: API key generated and saved
‚è≥ Step 5: Test issue created successfully
‚è≥ Step 6: Information provided for MCP integration
```

## Detailed Progress

### **‚úÖ COMPLETED**

#### **Step 1: Workspace Creation**
- **Status**: ‚úÖ Complete

- **Account**: omar.mountassir@gmail.com
- **Completion Date**: 2025-08-03

#### **Step 2: Team Structure**
- **Status**: ‚úÖ Complete  
- **Teams Created**: 3/3
  - ‚úÖ Engineering (ENG) - Technical work and feature development
  - ‚úÖ Documentation (DOCS) - Content creation and maintenance
  - ‚úÖ Process (PROC) - Workflow improvements and automation
- **Decision**: Chose Engineering + Process structure for clear separation
- **Completion Date**: 2025-08-03

### **‚è≥ PENDING**

#### **Step 3: Project Setup**
- **Status**: ‚è≥ Pending
- **Required**: Create 3 projects
  - [ ] Phase 1: Foundation Enhancement (Linear integration setup)
  - [ ] Phase 2: Integration Development (GitHub-Linear automation)
  - [ ] Phase 3: Advanced Automation (Intelligence layer)
- **Next Action**: Navigate to Projects and create these 3 projects

#### **Step 4: API Configuration**
- **Status**: ‚è≥ Pending
- **Required**:
  - [ ] Generate API key with full permissions
  - [ ] Save API key securely
  - [ ] Note Team ID for MCP configuration
- **Next Action**: Go to Workspace Settings ‚Üí API

#### **Step 5: Testing**
- **Status**: ‚è≥ Pending
- **Required**:
  - [ ] Create test issue in Engineering team
  - [ ] Verify all functionality works
  - [ ] Confirm project assignment works
- **Next Action**: Create test issue after projects are set up

#### **Step 6: MCP Integration Handoff**
- **Status**: ‚è≥ Pending
- **Required Information**:
  - [ ] Workspace URL: https://claude-agentic-dev.linear.app
  - [ ] API Key: lin_api_[to-be-generated]
  - [ ] Team ID: team_[to-be-identified]
  - [ ] Engineering Team Key: ENG
- **Next Action**: Provide information template after API key generation

## Next Immediate Steps

### **üéØ Current Priority: Complete Step 3 (Projects)**

**Action Items**:
1. **Navigate to Projects** in Linear workspace
2. **Create Project 1**: "Phase 1: Foundation Enhancement"
   - Description: "Linear integration and workflow setup"
   - Status: "In Progress"
3. **Create Project 2**: "Phase 2: Integration Development"
   - Description: "GitHub-Linear automation and synchronization"
   - Status: "Planned"
4. **Create Project 3**: "Phase 3: Advanced Automation"
   - Description: "Intelligence layer and optimization"
   - Status: "Planned"

### **üìã After Projects: API Key Generation**

**Action Items**:
1. **Access API Settings**: Workspace Settings ‚Üí API
2. **Create API Key**:
   - Name: "Claude Code MCP Integration"
   - Permissions: ALL (full access)
3. **Save Credentials**: Copy API key and Team ID
4. **Update this tracker** with completion status

## Integration Timeline

### **Estimated Completion**
- **Remaining Time**: 15-20 minutes
- **Steps 3-4**: 10 minutes
- **Step 5**: 5 minutes  
- **Step 6**: 5 minutes (information handoff)

### **Post-Setup Actions** (Handled by Claude)
- MCP server configuration
- GitHub Actions enhancement
- Integration testing
- Documentation updates

## Success Criteria

### **Setup Complete When**:
- [x] Workspace accessible and functional
- [x] All 3 teams created with proper structure
- [ ] All 3 projects created and organized
- [ ] API key generated with full permissions
- [ ] Test issue created successfully
- [ ] Information provided for MCP integration

### **Ready for Integration When**:
